name: Dialog

jtbd.functional: Focus user attention on a critical decision or information that requires acknowledgment. Trap keyboard focus within the dialog until dismissed.
jtbd.affordance: Centered overlay with backdrop dimming. Users immediately recognize this as a modal requiring their attention. Header/body/footer structure communicates purpose and available actions.
jtbd.emotional: Communicates importance without alarm. The backdrop blur and scale-in animation signal 'this needs your attention' without feeling aggressive.

anatomy.backdrop: .t-dialog-backdrop — Fixed overlay covering the viewport with dimmed background
anatomy.dialog: .t-dialog — Centered content container with max-width and scroll
anatomy.title: .t-dialog__title — Dialog heading text
anatomy.body: .t-dialog__body — Main content area with secondary text color
anatomy.footer: .t-dialog__footer — Action buttons aligned to the right

size.default: max-width: 560px — standard dialog for most use cases

accessibility.ariaModal: true — indicates content behind is inert
accessibility.keyboard: Escape closes. Tab cycles within dialog (focus trap). Initial focus on first focusable element or close button.
accessibility.focusTrap: Focus must not escape the dialog while open. On close, focus returns to the trigger element.
accessibility.screenReader: Dialog title announced on open. Close button must have accessible name.

knownIssues: Focus trap requires JavaScript — CSS cannot enforce
futureConsiderations: Confirmation dialog preset with danger action
Sheet variant (slides from edge instead of center)
Non-modal dialog variant (no backdrop, no focus trap)
